title: Jhin is the most mobile ADC in the game right now lmao.
body:
Legit, I just played Nocturne vs Jhin, I would ult him and he would walk away with 800 ms because of {{item:3095}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3009}} and hail of blades.

Why the fuck hasn't this been addressed?

His Q only does decent damage based on it's previous bounces, his W is only useful for a snare, roses are only useful if you're dumb enough to chill on top of them and his ult is only strong if you're low at all like ANY executing ultimate. So, his main power is his movement speed, his auto attacks, and above all his placement. Shitty placement by itself is an easy death, then he also needs peel to stay efficient. I hate when folks don't play or acknowledge the champion they're calling OP when there's TONS to take into mind. Even with the ardent censor meta, Jhin was more weak than all other ADC's that scaled well with attack speed i.e. Tristana, Ashe, Vayne, Xayah, Draven, Caitlyn, Sivir etc etc. He deserves to have a spotlight right now.

Made a post a while ago about how just stormrazor gives jhin access to 610 MS with each auto if he is kiting correctly against melee, thats nearly 100 MS more than Udyr gets from his E at lv 5 and normal build. I didn't use hail of blades at the time because I wasnt thinking about keystones but more about the item in general, but his synergy needs to be nerfed with the item.
Noc needs to go with the snowball assassin build to work, he doesnt have the innate tankiness or durability booster to use duelist builds compared to the rest anymore.

Honestly you people thinking Nocturne does anything to ADC's must be playing from a sub-gold perspective.

Literally all you have to do is group up, and Nocturne cant do anything unless his team can 4v5 you in the first place.
